alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 9:44AM CST until January 28 at 9:06AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Morales affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Morales. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding occurs as water inundates County Road 283. Livestock could be cut off and should be removed from the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Saturday the stage was 31.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Saturday was 32.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 9.5 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.8 feet on 06/22/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Navidad River Morales 29.0 31.7 Sat 9 am CST 17.1 12.0 10.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening. late tonight at 345 AM CST.
